Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Description: Small high-necked jug with a flattened lip, carinated waist and vertical handle. On the lip, the base of the neck, the handle and on the waist it bears a geometric pattern of black lines. The base is circular.This vessel was found with a group of 11 other small vessels. Its form is inspired by foreign pottery, probably Cypriot or Palestinian.
